quarks.oplet.core

Class Pipe<I,O>

  • java.lang.Object
    • quarks.oplet.core.AbstractOplet<I,O>
      • quarks.oplet.core.Pipe<I,O>
  • Type Parameters:
    I - Data container type for input tuples.
    O - Data container type for output tuples.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.AutoCloseable, Consumer<I>, Oplet<I,O>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Aggregate, Filter, FlatMap, Isolate, Map, Peek, PressureReliever, UnorderedIsolate

    public abstract class Pipe<I,O>
extends AbstractOplet<I,O>
implements Consumer<I>
    Pipe oplet with a single input and output.
    See Also:

      • start

        public void start()
        Description copied from interface: Oplet
        Start the oplet. Oplets must not submit any tuples not derived from input tuples until this method is called.
        Specified by:
        start in interface Oplet<I,O>

      • getInputs

        public java.util.List<Consumer<I>> getInputs()
        Description copied from interface: Oplet
        Get the input stream data handlers for this oplet. The number of handlers must equal the number of configured input ports. Each tuple arriving on an input port will be sent to the stream handler for that input port.
        Specified by:
        getInputs in interface Oplet<I,O>
        Returns:
        list of consumers
